DOC.brief_summary: Post-approval study evaluate rate visual distortion patient require > 2.0 D corneal astigmatism correction
DOC.criteria: Minimum 22 year age Bilateral cataracts Preoperative keratometric cylinder eye Most appropriate toric IOL model choice ( ZCT300 ZCT400 ) Predicted residual refractive cylinder , base AMO Toric IOL Calculator , must : ≤ 0.69 D ZCT300 IOL ≤ 0.88 D ZCT400 IOL Clear intraocular medium cataract eye Availability , willingness , ability sufficient cognitive awareness comply examination procedure study visit Ability understand , read write English order consent study participation complete study questionnaire Signed informed consent HIPAA authorization Irregular corneal astigmatism Any corneal pathology/abnormality regular corneal astigmatism Previous corneal surgery Recent ocular trauma intraocular surgery resolved/stable may affect visual outcome Any pupil abnormality Subjects condition associate increase risk zonular rupture , include capsular zonular abnormality may lead IOL decentration , include pseudoexfoliation , trauma , posterior capsule defect Known ocular disease pathology may affect visual acuity may require surgical intervention course study Concurrent participation participation 30 day prior preoperative visit clinical study Planned monovision correction Patient pregnant , plan become pregnant , lactate another condition associate fluctuation hormone could lead refractive change
